member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.AnalyzerTest`1.MatchDiagnostics(System.ValueTuple{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Project,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostic}[],Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticResult[])
member.summary: Match actual diagnostics with expected diagnostics.

remarks.para: While each actual diagnostic contains complete information about the diagnostic (location, severity, message, etc.), the expected diagnostics sometimes contain partial information. It is therefore possible for an expected diagnostic to match more than one actual diagnostic, while another expected diagnostic with more complete information only matches a single specific actual diagnostic.
This method attempts to find a best matching of actual and expected diagnostics.

member.param: The actual diagnostics reported by analysis.
The expected diagnostics.

returns.para: A collection of matched diagnostics, with the following characteristics:

item.description: Every element of will appear exactly once as the first element of an item in the result.
Every element of will appear exactly once as the second element of an item in the result.
An item in the result which specifies both a and a indicates a matched pair, i.e. the actual and expected results are believed to refer to the same diagnostic.
An item in the result which specifies only a indicates an actual diagnostic for which no matching expected diagnostic was found.
An item in the result which specifies only a indicates an expected diagnostic for which no matching actual diagnostic was found.

list.para: If no exact match is found (all actual diagnostics are matched to an expected diagnostic without errors), this method is allowed to attempt fall-back matching using a strategy intended to minimize the total number of mismatched pairs.

member.summary: Helper method to that checks the location of a and compares it with the location described by a .
member.param: The analyzer that have been run on the sources.
The diagnostic that was found in the code.
The expected diagnostic.
The location of the diagnostic found in the code.
The describing the expected location of the diagnostic.
The verifier to use for test assertions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CodeActionValidationMode
member.summary: Specifies the validation mode for code actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CodeActionValidationMode.None
member.summary: Code action verification is limited to the raw text produced by the action.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CodeActionValidationMode.SemanticStructure
member.summary: Code action verification ensures that semantic structure of the tree produced by the code action matches the form produced by the compiler when parsing the text form of the document. Differences in trivia nodes, in particular the associativity of to leading or trailing trivia lists, is ignored.

remarks.para: Code actions are generally expected to adhere to this validation mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CodeActionValidationMode.Full
member.summary: Code action verification ensures that the tree produced by a code action exactly matches the form of the tree produced by the compiler when parsing the text representation of the tree.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CompilerDiagnostics
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of compiler diagnostics in validation scenarios.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CompilerDiagnostics.None
member.summary: All compiler diagnostics are ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CompilerDiagnostics.Errors
member.summary: Compiler errors are included in verification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CompilerDiagnostics.Warnings
member.summary: Compiler errors and warnings are included in verification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CompilerDiagnostics.Suggestions
member.summary: Compiler errors, warnings, and suggestions are included in verification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.CompilerDiagnostics.All
member.summary: All compiler diagnostics are included in verification.

member.summary: Defines options for interpreting .

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticLocationOptions.None
member.summary: The diagnostic location is a simple .

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticLocationOptions.IgnoreLength
member.summary: The diagnostic location is defined as a position instead of a span. The length of the actual diagnostic span should be ignored when comparing results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticLocationOptions.InterpretAsMarkupKey
member.summary:
The diagnostic location is defined in markup. The associated has the following characteristics:
The is an empty string.
The is 0.
The is the index of the markup span which defines the location. For example, an index of 5 would appear using the markup syntax {|#5:...|} or {|#5:...|#5}.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticOptions
member.summary: Defines options for interpreting .

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticOptions.None
member.summary: The result should be interpreted using the default settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticOptions.IgnoreAdditionalLocations
member.summary: The primary diagnostic location is defined, but additional locations have not been provided. Disables validation of additional locations reported for the corresponding diagnostics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.DiagnosticOptions.IgnoreSeverity
member.summary: Ignore the diagnostic severity when verifying this diagnostic result.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupMode
member.summary: Indicates the manner in which markup syntax is treated within test inputs and outputs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupMode.None
member.summary: Markup syntax is disabled, and any syntax which could be treated as markup is preserved in the contents of sources and additional files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupMode.Ignore
member.summary: Markup syntax is allowed, but diagnostics suggested by markup syntax is ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupMode.IgnoreFixable
member.summary: Markup syntax is allowed, but fixable diagnostics suggested by markup syntax are ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupMode.Allow
member.summary: Markup syntax is allowed, and all diagnostics indicated by markup syntax are preserved.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupOptions
member.summary: Specifies additional options for the markup parser.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupOptions.None
member.summary: No additional markup options are specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MarkupOptions.UseFirstDescriptor
member.summary: Use the first matching diagnostic descriptor when multiple diagnostics match the syntax. By default, this option is not specified and the markup parser will fail when the syntax does not represent a unique descriptor.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.MetadataReferences

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.SolutionState.InheritanceMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating the manner in which properties are inherited from base test states. When this property is not set to a specific value, the default varies according to the type of test state:
For original (input) sources, the default value is .
For fixed (output) sources, the default value is .
For uncorrected (output) sources, the default value is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.SolutionState.AdditionalProjects
member.summary: Gets a collection of additional projects to include in the solution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.SolutionState.ExpectedDiagnostics
member.summary: Gets the list of diagnostics expected in the source(s) and/or additonal files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.SolutionState.MarkupHandling
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating the manner in which markup syntax is treated within test inputs and outputs. When this property is not set to a specific value, the default varies according to the type of test state:
For original (input) sources, the default value is .
For fixed (output) sources, the default value is .
For uncorrected (output) sources, the default value is .

remarks.para: Diagnostics expressed using markup are combined with explicitly-specified expected diagnostics.
Supported markup syntax includes the following:

item.description: [|text|]: indicates that a diagnostic is reported for text. The diagnostic descriptor is located via . This syntax may only be used when the first analyzer provided by supports a single diagnostic.

{|ID1:text|}: indicates that a diagnostic with ID ID1 is reported for text. The diagnostic descriptor for ID1 is located via . If no matching descriptor is found, the diagnostic is assumed to be a compiler-reported diagnostic with the specified ID and severity .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.SolutionState.WithInheritedValuesApplied(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.SolutionState,System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableArray{System.String})
member.summary: Applies the using a specified base state.

remarks.para: This method evaluates , and places the resulting additional files in the collection of the result before returning.

member.param: The base state to inherit from, or if the current state is the root state.
The set of diagnostic IDs to treat as fixable. Fixable diagnostics present in the collection of the base state are only inherited for .
member.returns: A new representing the current state with inherited values applied where appropriate. The of the result is .

member.summary: Processes the markup syntax for this according to the current , and returns a new with the , , , , and updated accordingly.

The set of diagnostic IDs to treat as fixable. This value is only used when is .
The default file path for diagnostics reported in source code.
member.returns: A new with all markup processing completed according to the current . The of the returned instance is .

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.StateInheritanceMode
member.summary: Indicates the manner in which properties are inherited from base test states.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.StateInheritanceMode.AutoInherit
member.summary: The contents of the may be explicitly specified, but unspecified elements of partially-specified state instances are inherited from another source. Fixable diagnostics are not inherited.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.StateInheritanceMode.Explicit
member.summary: The contents of the are fully and explicitly specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.StateInheritanceMode.AutoInheritAll
member.summary: The contents of the may be explicitly specified, but unspecified elements of partially-specified state instances are inherited from another source. All diagnostics, including fixable diagnostics, are inherited.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.TestBehaviors
member.summary: Specifies non-standard analyzer behaviors which impact testing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.TestBehaviors.None
member.summary: No special behaviors apply.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.TestBehaviors.SkipGeneratedCodeCheck
member.summary: Skip the generated code exclusion check.

remarks.para: This flag is only used in cases where one or more analyzers does not explicitly configure generated code analysis via the API.

By default, the analyzer test framework verifies that analyzer which report diagnostics do not report diagnostics in generated code. While some analyzers, e.g. security analyzers, are expected to report diagnostics in all code, most analyzers are expected to only report diagnostics in user-created code.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.TestBehaviors.SkipSuppressionCheck
member.summary: Skip a verification check that diagnostics will not be reported if a #pragma warning disable appears at the beginning of the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.TestBehaviors.SkipGeneratedSourcesCheck
member.summary: Skip a verification check that the contents of match the sources produced by the active source generators (if any).
member.remarks: When this flag is set, the property is completely ignored; tests are encouraged to leave it empty for optimal readability.

summary.para: To aid with testing, we define a special type of text file that can encode additional information in it. This prevents a test writer from having to carry around multiple sources of information that must be reconstituted. For example, instead of having to keep around the contents of a file and and the location of the cursor, the tester can just provide a string with the $$ character in it. This allows for easy creation of "FIT" tests where all that needs to be provided are strings that encode every bit of state necessary in the string itself.
The current set of encoded features we support are:

item.description: A position in the file. The number of times this is allowed to appear varies depending on the specific call.
A span of text in the file. There can be many of these and they can be nested and/or overlap the $$ position.
A span of text in the file annotated with an identifier. There can be many of these, including ones with the same name.

summary.para: Additional encoded features can be added on a case by case basis.

member.summary: Parses the input markup to find standalone positions and the start and end positions of text spans.
member.param: The input markup.
The output content with markup syntax removed from .
A list of positions defined in markup ($$).

A list of starting positions of spans in markup. The key of the element is a position (the location of the [| or {|). The value of the element is the text content of a {|text: starting syntax, or if the [| syntax was used. This list preserves the original order of starting markup tags in the input.

A list of ending positions of spans in markup. The key of the element is a position (the location of the |] or |}). The value of the element is the #id content of a |#id} ending syntax, or if the |] or |} syntax was used. This list preserves the original order of the ending markup tags in the input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing.TestFileMarkupParser.GetPosition(System.String,System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Process markup containing exactly one position.
member.param: The input markup.
The output, with markup syntax removed.
The location of the $$ position in .
member.exception: If does not contain exactly one position, indicated by $$.
